content:
Seems like whenever I run the igpublisher, the numbers of errors reported in the command line can be twice as many as I see in qa.html. Am I missing something?
e.g.,

...
Final .zip built                                                                 (00:27.0670)
Finished. 00:11.0560. Validation output in [/blah/blah]/output/qa.html
Errors: 4  Warnings: 2  Info: 2 (00:27.0922)
Done                                                                             (00:27.0927)

vs
image.png
Command line warnings and qa warnings aren't necessarily the same thing. Each should be reveiwed separately
There's a filtering process that removes duplicates. It's possible the filtering process isn't influencing the total counts. I thought I had this fixed, but possibly not.
I see the same thing. The local build reports exactly double the number of errors and other messages as qa.html.

do these count as 1 or 2 errors?
image.png
I just provide the differential, it's the publisher that makes the snapshot.
(doesn't really make a difference to me, but I thought this could be influencing the count)
